p: Influenza is a communicable respiratory disease caused by the influenza virus. The disease severity may range from mild to severe, sometimes leading to fatality, especially among infants, elderly, immune-compromised persons and various other high risk groups.The World Health Organization (WHO) has reported 3–5 million cases of severe illness and 290,000–650,000 deaths worldwide in 2017 due to seasonal influenza epidemics [ 1].
